byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: News Analysis; American officials are hoping that Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani, who is scheduled to meet with Pres Obama, will be more amenable to work with than previous Afghan leader Hamid Karzai; observe that Ghani is much more schooled in Washington's political culture and shares a more pro-Western outlook.
lead_paragraph: When President Obama meets this week with Ashraf Ghani, he will finally be sitting across from an Afghan leader who is not suspicious or openly belligerent toward his American allies.

headline.main: For Obama, Ghani Offers Hope of a Less Fractious Relationship
headline.print_headline: For Obama, New Afghan President Offers Hope of an Ally Who Acts Like One
